subject: AI
title: Agent Handoffs
description: Transferring context and control between agents seamlessly.

hook.text: A triage agent determines the user needs billing help. It hands off to the billing agent. But the billing agent doesn't know the user's name or what they already asked.

buildup.text: Handoffs transfer control from one agent to another. The critical question: what context travels with the handoff? Too little and the new agent is clueless. Too much and you waste tokens.

discovery.text: A good handoff payload includes: a summary of the conversation so far, the specific task being delegated, and any relevant extracted data (user ID, issue type, etc.).

twist.text: Handoff failures are invisible to users â€” they just feel like the system forgot everything. Test handoffs specifically: does the receiving agent have enough context to continue naturally?

climax.text: Design a handoff protocol: structured payload, required fields, optional context, and a return path so the new agent can hand back if needed.

punchline.text: A seamless handoff feels like one agent. A bad one feels like being transferred to 5 departments.

quiz.question: What is the most important element of an agent handoff?
options: Passing sufficient conversation context and task details to the receiving agent
Using the same model for both agents
